reviewText: This is a great video describing the contents of Lots & Lots of Trucks Vol. 1 Hard Workin Trucks and Vol. 2 Mighty Tough Trucks Lots and Lots of Trucks DVD Movie Vol. 2 that are part of the Lots and Lots of Series of DVDs. Just look up Lots and Lots of and you'll see the entire DVD series. LOTS AND LOTS OF FIRE TRUCKS VOL. 1 AND VOL. 2 Lots and Lots of Fire Trucks DVD Vol. 1 LOTS AND LOTS OF MONSTER TRUCKS VOL.1 Lots and Lots of Monster Trucks DVD Vol. 1 MONSTER TRUCK CLASSICS MONSTER TRUCK CLASSICS 3 DVD Set LOTS AND LOTS OF TRAINS Vol. 1, Vol. 2 and Vol. 3 Lots and Lots of Trains DVD Vol 1 LOTS AND LOTS OF TOY TRAINS AND MODEL RAILROADS VOL.1 Lots and Lots of Toy Trains and Model Railroads Volume 1 DVD Movie LOTS AND LOTS OF JETS AND PLANES VOL. 1 AND VOL. 2 Lots and Lots of JETS and PLANES DVD Vol. 1 LOTS AND LOTS OF JETS AND PLANES Vol. 3 LOTS and LOTS of JETS and PLANES DVD Vol. 3 LOTS AND LOTS OF PLAYFUL PENGUINS Lots and Lots of Playful Penguins & Their Toe-Tappin Feet -All About Penguins DVDLOTS AND LOTS OF PENGUINS IN THE WILD Lots and Lots of Penguins In The Wild DVD These are all award-winning DVDs that make great gifts for kids of all ages and are not available in stores so order here! Kids with autism love them too because they contain lots of action shots and fun, sing-a-long music from award-winning childrens musician James Coffey.

I bought this video with two others for my son.  This one is by far his favorite. He loves the songs & they're not even that obnoxious for the grownups of the house to listen to over & over again. I'm seriously considering buying other videos from the Lots & lots series. Well worth the 15 dollars.

My almost 3-year old son picked this DVD out at the library and has watched it daily.  The DVD comprises of video clips of various trucks on the road.  Each truck group has it's own song - which is a catchy, rock kind of a song.  I personally cannot sit through the DVD because it cannot hold my attention - however it holds the attention of my son and my 5-year old daughter.  Great way for your little truck lover to get his or her fill of trucks!

This truck DVD is really just a collection of videos someone has
taken. My nephew wasn't the least bit interested. Maybe he will
be when he is older.
I was very pleased...my nephew, who has autism, loved the dvd so much he danced through the whole thing!
This film is great, my 3 year old son just loves it. We watch it several times a week.
Bought this for my grandsons for Christmas.  They can't take their eyes off it.  They love it!

My two boys are 1 and 4, they absolutely go crazy for this truck video. The music, film footage and variety of trucks are great. It gets them up at the crack of dawn asking to watch it, over and over again! The length of the video is perfect- definitely worth it! I also own most other DVD's in the lots and lots series and recommend the entire collection. Fire Trucks, Trains, and even the penquins! I cant wait for the second in this set. Thanks Tom, awesome job! Lots and Lots of Trucks Vol. 1 Lots and Lots of Trains DVD Vol 1Lots and Lots of Trains DVD Vol. 2 Lots and Lots of Trains DVD Vol. 3 Lots and Lots of Fire Trucks DVD Vol. 1Lots and Lots of Fire Trucks DVD Vol. 2
Three year old grandson loves this

My grandson (3 yo) is obsessed with trucks and he watches volumes one and two incessantly.  Only complaint is from parents that the song is starting to drive them nuts.  It's good to be a grandparent.
Great condition.
Excellent service and product.
My nephew is obsessed with this
LOVES IT! he power of trucks and little boys. just lots of different trucks in real life working hard. he loves it
As posted by others, while this may not appeal to an adult, a truck-loving toddler will love this video!
We got this for a gift for our 3 year old grandson & he loves it.  Great DVD for little folks, boys or girls.

I cannot say that I dislike the content of the DVD. I can't say that because my kid actually can't watch it due to the DVD not being secured in the packaging. During transit it shifted around inside the case and got scratched and chipped all over. This may very well be the perfect little thing for him to watch, but I certainly wouldn't know it.
I gave it as a gift for a 2 year old hopefully he likes it
My grandson loves it.

My son LOVES this video. The songs are also helping him with his language development. Parents be warned, these songs will stick in your head so be prepared to find yourself singing "lots and lots of trucks!"
Shipped quick, Works great.
Nice footage, but have a 2/12 yr old great nephew that is interested in the REAL names of equipment. Expected more detail in that regard.
Lots of short clips of trucks working.

This video just does not keep his attention. It has lots and lots of trucks. The trucks are only shown for a few seconds each. He is 2.5 and loves trucks of all sorts. Perhaps the music is too boring for him.

But drives me nuts. How many times a day can a three year old watch the same show?  The answer is more times than you want to know. I sing the  'Lots and lots of trucks' theme song in my sleep (although it is far more entertaining to hear my son sing it).

If you have a young child into trucks- this is the dvd for you.  One word of caution and advise- buy headphones.

I think he could watch this video over and over all day long. He watched it, keeping his full attention on it and then wanted to watch it again. He is 4 years old and loves trucks and construction sites. Bouncy music - for adults, almost too much of a good thing!
Our two-year-old grandson loves it!  What fun!!!
My grandson is in love with trucks and love this DVD. I will look for others for him to enjoy.

My son loves anything with wheels. Before he could talk, he could make a number of realistic vehicle sounds. He would disappear in his room for an hour just to roll a truck back and forth. We got this DVD to occupy him on a road trip when he was 17 months old. He's about to turn 3 in a few weeks and it is still his favorite. He makes me sing the songs to him at bedtime. He hums the tunes while reading picture books about trucks. This DVD is fantastic! Worth every single penny!
Just purchased this DVD and have watched 3 times. My grandson loves the introduction song and dances to it every time. Ordered another one to send home with him!!!!!
my son loves anything trucks.  very good buy and hours upon hours of watching enjoyment  highly recommend making this purchase
My grandson is mesmerized by this video.  He is two years old and loves trucks and tractors.  This is packed with all of that.

I have an 8 year old with autism and he absolutely loves these videos because they are real-life, not animated.  They are so realistic with all of the sights and sounds that he gets totally absorbed.  There is not a ridiculous amount of narration as in some others we own, so you really get to hear the sounds of life with those trucks.  Highly recommend!
Well what 7 yr old boy wouldn't just love a DVD about trucks? This guys son loves this DVD and watches it ALL the time.

The DVD started out great, my son loved the first minute of it but then it started freezing and skipping. I tried cleaning it and it didn't matter, I think the quality of the disc was very poor. Really unhappy, I bought another one from a different website and it works great.

Lots and lots of trucks indeed... the picture quality's not good, and the songs are both insidiously inane and catchy, but by golly if it doesn't deliver trucks as promised!  Downsides include the toy trucks segment at the end and the scenes of the Bigfoot monster truck crashing and losing a wheel (this upsets my toddler).
From an adult view, somewhat of a low budget film, but to a little boy who loves trucks, it is an academy-award winner. Fun songs to accompany the  video.

My twin 28 month boys love this DVD. If you've bought the Lots of Planes or Lots of Trains from the same company, it's much the same. I find the lyrics and music to be annoying(but very catchy) and most of the footage is recycled over and over again. But the kids love it and that's all that matters.
The song may be annoying for adults, but my boys (2 & 4) love to sing along!  Shows all different kinds of trucks, and my kids ask to watch it over and over again.

we own several other series, and this is my 2 yr olds favorite. we mix it up from time to time, but the pacing and music of this dvd stops him in his tracks and keeps him glued for the 30 mins. As a parent subjected to watching 1000 times with him, this is the least annoying/boring of all the truck dvds we own.

I think I expected excellence but got good.  We watch it but it's not a favorite when we can choose from Concrete Truck, Garbage Truck or this.  They could have taken a bit more time on some of the shots and gone into a bit more detail.
This movie is super cheesy but our 2 year old LOVES it! I'm not sure what awards the music has won, but it's catchy and silly. I'd recommend it if you have a truck lover in your home!

The Amazon.com warehouse must have a basement.  In that basement, in a dark corner that no one goes except maybe a few times a year, is where they probably keep their supply of 'Lots and Lots of Trucks Vol. 1' dvd's.

We found and showed the YouTube promo of this dvd to our son and he got excited.  It was ordered for his 4th birthday, and he LOVES is.  Crying ensues when this 40 minute video is over.  I'm not sure what the appeal is, but this production has some magical hold on toddler boys.

From an adult's prospective, this truck video can be summarized as a compilation of stock early 1990's footage combined with some home movies all set to music.  There is no commentary in this video; it's just a ballad of hard working trucks.  It perhaps looks like something that could have been spliced together in someone's basement over a weekend.  Nonetheless, the kids love it!

I will be buying Volume 2!

As stated previously in lots and lots of trucks Vol 2, this is not worth the money paid and am trying to return same....this video is just songs and no narratives.  Grandson very disappointed in these and told me that I wasted my money getting them.

I got this for my 3 year old nephew who loves trucks.  He loves this DVD.  The footage is real life trucks and big machines doing their thing, no cartoons or other graphics.  He is amazed by all of the big earthmovers.  A great gift if your little one is at all into trucks.

My son is 18 months old and he is obsessed with this video.  Sure, it's missing narration and lots of the footage is dated and/or is grainy in quality -- my toddler doesn't care.  All he wants to do is watch the multitude of trucks that fill the screen and listen to the James Coffey soundtrack over and over and over again while Mom can sit down and eat dinner.
Bought this for my son who is only 9 months but seems to be interested in anything with wheels. He loves this DVD. And my husband loves watching it with him too!

My two year old absolutely LOVES this DVD.  He will sit and watch the entire thing, allowing me to get something done in the house without him following me around and wanted to "help" with everything I do.  It is a fast paced dvd with many different video clips so he doesn't get bored with any one thing like he does with other videos.  I'm very happy with it and plan on getting more dvds from the lots and lots series!

There is not a ridiculous amount of narration as in some others we own, so you really get to hear the sounds of life with those trucks.  Highly recommend!

I find the lyrics and music to be annoying(but very catchy) and most of the footage is recycled over and over again. But the kids love it and that's all that matters.
The song may be annoying for adults, but my boys (2 & 4) love to sing along!  Shows all different kinds of trucks, and my kids ask to watch it over and over again.

we own several other series, and this is my 2 yr olds favorite. we mix it up from time to time, but the pacing and music of this dvd stops him in his tracks and keeps him glued for the 30 mins. As a parent subjected to watching 1000 times with him, this is the least annoying/boring of all the truck dvds we own.

I think I expected excellence but got good.  We watch it but it's not a favorite when we can choose from Concrete Truck, Garbage Truck or this.  They could have taken a bit more time on some of the shots and gone into a bit more detail.
This movie is super cheesy but our 2 year old LOVES it! I'm not sure what awards the music has won, but it's catchy and silly. I'd recommend it if you have a truck lover in your home!

The Amazon.com warehouse must have a basement.  In that basement, in a dark corner that no one goes except maybe a few times a year, is where they probably keep their supply of 'Lots and Lots of Trucks Vol. 1' dvd's.

We found and showed the YouTube promo of this dvd to our son and he got excited.  It was ordered for his 4th birthday, and he LOVES is.  Crying ensues when this 40 minute video is over.  I'm not sure what the appeal is, but this production has some magical hold on toddler boys.

From an adult's prospective, this truck video can be summarized as a compilation of stock early 1990's footage combined with some home movies all set to music.  There is no commentary in this video; it's just a ballad of hard working trucks.  It perhaps looks like something that could have been spliced together in someone's basement over a weekend.  Nonetheless, the kids love it!

I will be buying Volume 2!

As stated previously in lots and lots of trucks Vol 2, this is not worth the money paid and am trying to return same....this video is just songs and no narratives.  Grandson very disappointed in these and told me that I wasted my money getting them.

I got this for my 3 year old nephew who loves trucks.  He loves this DVD.  The footage is real life trucks and big machines doing their thing, no cartoons or other graphics.  He is amazed by all of the big earthmovers.  A great gift if your little one is at all into trucks.

My son is 18 months old and he is obsessed with this video.  Sure, it's missing narration and lots of the footage is dated and/or is grainy in quality -- my toddler doesn't care.  All he wants to do is watch the multitude of trucks that fill the screen and listen to the James Coffey soundtrack over and over and over again while Mom can sit down and eat dinner.
Bought this for my son who is only 9 months but seems to be interested in anything with wheels. He loves this DVD. And my husband loves watching it with him too!

My two year old absolutely LOVES this DVD.  He will sit and watch the entire thing, allowing me to get something done in the house without him following me around and wanted to "help" with everything I do.  It is a fast paced dvd with many different video clips so he doesn't get bored with any one thing like he does with other videos.  I'm very happy with it and plan on getting more dvds from the lots and lots series!
My nephew's all love anything to do with trucks and tractors and this was a big hit.
My 3 year old grandson loves trucks he really enjoyed this dvd plus they sang a snappy song .
Grandson loves TRUCKS...he would watch this all day if he could.
Are you kidding?  Try pulling this away from my 2 year old grandson.  I dare ya.
3-year-old grandson loved the DVD!  Need one that's only about farm machinery.

19 month old loves it. Will be my go-to when mommy needs a break. Catchy songs, and nothing but trucks. Love how the songs line up to the type of trucks they're showing (they have blocks of different types featured: farm, monster, construction, etc.). He's already in love with trucks. This just cemented it! Get it, you need it.
My 3 year old grandson didn't even watch the 1st five minutes of this DVD

Not yet played CD for 3 & 4 y/o Grandson's.
 But just seeing the "Original Bigfoot" brought a smile to MY face:  that's "a big for sure".  The boys will love it I am certain.  Boys and trucks.  Boys and trucks...all kinds trucks.  Great educational and entertaining video product.
This is a great DVD for toddlers.  My grandson watches this ALL THE TIME!  The music is fun and we like to dance to it sometimes.  It has a LOT of fun trucks and construction vehicles.  He loves it.
I think these are secretly made for dads, I get a kick out of them. Oh, almost forgot, my 4 year old son likes them too!
